headline.main: MERISTAR HOTELS TO MERGE WITH INTERSTATE

docs.abstract: MeriStar Hotels and Resorts acquires Interstate Hotels Corp for $53 million in stock and assumption of $15 million of Interstate debt; new company will be named Interstate Hotels Corp (S)
docs.lead_paragraph: MeriStar Hotels and Resorts said yesterday that it had agreed to buy the Interstate Hotels Corporation for $53 million in stock in a move that will combine two hotel managers. MeriStar will issue 4.6 shares of its stock in exchange for each of Interstate's 12.2 million outstanding shares, a spokesman for MeriStar said. Based on MeriStar's closing share price yesterday of 95 cents, Interstate shareholders will get $4.37 a share, a 67 percent premium to Wednesday's closing price of $2.61. MeriStar will also assume $15 million of Interstate debt. The combined company will manage 412 hotels, including Marriotts, Hiltons and Sheratons, worldwide. The new company, to be named the Interstate Hotels Corporation, will be based in Washington.

headline.main: Radisson and SAS Form Hotel Pact

docs.lead_paragraph: Hoping to create a larger global presence, Radisson Hotels International announced yesterday that it has formed an alliance with SAS International Hotels, a subsidiary of Scandinavian Airlines System. The agreement includes 30 SAS hotels in nine European countries, as well as in Kuwait and China. And it gives SAS the right to develop additional Radisson hotels in Europe. SAS will manage and operate the hotels, which will soon bear the Radisson/ SAS Hotels Worldwide logo, while Radisson will market them around the world and link the hotels to its existing reservations system.

headline.main: Hotels vs. Airbnb: Let the Battle Begin

docs.abstract: The Getaway column notes changes adopted by hotel industry that mimic homey amenities offered by increasingly popular Airbnb.
docs.lead_paragraph: Hoteliers say they see changes in guests’ preferences as a result of Airbnb’s popularity, resulting in new social-oriented brands and homier settings.

headline.print_headline: Rooms for Rent-Australian Hotels Expand Rapidly to Catch Chinese Tourism Boom
headline.main: Rooms for Rent-Australian Hotels Expand Rapidly to Catch Chinese Tourism Boom

docs.lead_paragraph: The hole in Australia's economy dug by China's dwindling appetite for its resources is being filled by the Chinese themselves, whose growing affluence is powering a surge in travellers in a boon to tourism income and growth.

headline.print_headline: Dorchester Hotels Falling Out of Fashion
headline.main: Dorchester Hotels Falling Out of Fashion

byline.original: By JOHN KOBLIN and MATTHEW SCHNEIER

docs.abstract: Fashion industry is considering boycott of Dorchester Collection hotels, which are owned by Brunei Sultan Hassanal Bolkiah; sultan's country is implementing new penal code that will include, among other things, harsh punishments for gay sex and adultery.
docs.lead_paragraph: The fashion industry is considering a boycott of a hotel group over public policy in Brunei.

headline.main: Traveler Magazine Learns Luxury Service at Hotels
